meanings.definition: Showing or feeling strong dislike or hatred towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She gave an antipathetic glare to her rival in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The antipathetic neighbors always argued over the property line.
meanings.sent3: The antipathetic cat hissed at the new puppy in the house.
meanings.sent4: The antipathetic relationship between the two countries led to constant tension.
meanings.sent5: The antipathetic expression on his face made it clear he was not pleased.

meanings.sent1: The two antipathetic political parties could never agree on any issue.
meanings.sent2: The antipathetic personalities of the siblings often clashed.
meanings.sent3: It was comical to see the antipathetic reactions of the cats to the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The antipathetic forces of good and evil battled for control of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The antipathetic colors clashed horribly in the room's decor.

meanings.definition: Having a natural aversion or repugnance.
meanings.sent1: The antipathetic reaction to the foul smell was immediate.
meanings.sent2: She had an antipathetic response to the idea of eating insects.
meanings.sent3: The antipathetic feeling towards spiders made her scream at the sight of one.
meanings.sent4: The antipathetic taste of the medicine made the child refuse to take it.
meanings.sent5: The antipathetic sensation of touching slimy things made her shudder.
